text:
$ jmeter
/bin/ksh: jmeter:  not found
$ sh -x jmeter
USAGE=jmeter [-h proxyHost] [-p proxyPort] [-f property-file]
LOG4JCONFIG=log4j.configuration=log4j.conf
  
jmeter: ^M: not found
+ dirname jmeter 
PROPERTIES=./jmeter.properties
  
jmeter: ^M: not found
jmeter: syntax error at line 9: `in^M' unexpected
creator: juan_jose_pablos@yahoo.es

text:
Both 1.7 binary releases have the problem, I think that it could be fixed using
an option in Ant within the build.xml file.
creator: juan_jose_pablos@yahoo.es
juan_jose_pablos@yahoo.es
text:
A fix would be moving all unix scripts to *.sh and adding this to build.xml

on <target name="install" depends="package">

add this:
          <fixcrlf srcdir="." eol="lf" includes="**/*.sh" />
*** Bug 9836 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text: *** Bug 10854 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: mstover1@apache.org
jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
